text: The 2015 Men's Four Nations Cup was the third Hockey Four Nations Cup, an international men's field hockey tournament, consisting of a series of test matches. It was held in Hamburg, Germany, from July 30 to August 2, 2015, and featured four of the top nations in men's field hockey. ==Competition Format== The tournament featured the national teams of Belgium, England, Spain, and the hosts, Germany, competing in a round-robin format, with each team playing each other once. Three points were be awarded for a win, one for a draw, and none for a loss. {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="width:125px;"|Country ! style="width:200px;"|June 2015 FIH Ranking ! style="width:250px;"|Best World Cup Finish ! style="width:250px;"|Best Olympic Games Finish |- style="text- align:center;" |style="text-align:left;"| |4 |Fifth Place (2014) |Third Place (1920) |- style="text-align:center;" |style="text-align:left;"| |5 |Runners-up (1986) |Champions (1920, 1988) |- style="text-align:center;" |style="text- align:left;"| |3 |Champions (2006, 2010) |Champions (1992, 2008, 2012) |- style="text-align:center;" |style="text-align:left;"| |11 |Runners-up (1971, 1998) |Runners-up (1980, 1996, 2008) |} ==Results== ===Matches=== \---- \---- ==Statistics== ===Goalscorers=== ==References== 2015 Men Category:2015 in German sport Category:2015 in Belgian sport Category:2015 in English sport Category:2015 in Spanish sport Category:Sport in Hamburg Category:July 2015 sports events in Germany Category:August 2015 sports events in Germany
